snippet: Is the United States-Mexico border better secured than it used to be? Answering this question is complex, and it largely depends on which stretch of the border you consider.
abstract: Challenge to stop illegal immigration from Mexico into the United States has tied Congress in knots for decades, and as lawmakers in Washington pursue a sweeping overhaul of immigration law, the country is again debating what to do about border security; what remains unclear is the meaning of a secure border, how to measure it and what are reasonable expectations given the cost and challenges (Series: Watching The Line)

byline.contributor: Robert Gebeloff contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Is the United States-Mexico border better secured than it used to be? Answering this question is complex, and it largely depends on which stretch of the border you consider.

headline.seo: Border Security: Hard to Achieve, and Harder to Measure
